a6b443eb-0817-4679-b5d0-8e846cdc834e.description: The course objective is to teach students a basic understanding of the principles of inventory management. Students learn about operations management and explore their relationship to VHA operations.
a6b443eb-0817-4679-b5d0-8e846cdc834e.name: Principles of Inventory Management (GOTS) (FLG 100)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes and examinations with a minimum passing score of 80 percent.

The methods of instruction include audio visuals, practical exercises, lecture, discussion, and computer based training. The general course topics include operations management; inventory management; ordering techniques; inventory; related reporting; effective sourcing; quality management.

2032c43a-a3ba-48cf-9a13-e5779825c257.description: The course objective is to provide a basic understanding of the IFCAP and AEMS/MERS systems and how Level I Supply Chain Professionals utilize the systems in their assigned duties. Participants learn about the item requisition process within IFCAP. Students are taught the roles and responsibilities of IFCAP users and the relevance of each of these roles to their job. Students learn about management reporting mechanisms within IFCAP to assist with management of commodities and suppliers.
2032c43a-a3ba-48cf-9a13-e5779825c257.name: Introduction to IFCAP and AMES/MERS (FLG 103)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes and examinations with a minimum passing score of 80 percent.

The methods of instruction include audio visual materials, case studies, practical exercises, learner presentations, lecture, discussion, and classroom exercise. The general course topics include operations management; inventory management; ordering techniques; inventory related reporting; effective sourcing; quality management.

b72ebb63-259b-4be9-bc7f-2f52382ff774.description: The course objective is to teach students a basic understanding of the principles of inventory management. Students learn about operations management and explore their relationship to VHA operations.
b72ebb63-259b-4be9-bc7f-2f52382ff774.name: Introduction to IFCAP and GIP (FLG 102)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes and examinations with a minimum passing score of 80 percent.

The methods of instruction include audio visual materials, case studies, practical exercises, learner presentations, lecture, discussion, and classroom exercise. The general course topics include operations management; inventory management; ordering techniques; inventory related reporting; effective sourcing; quality management.

63bc7e84-6918-4d69-8a0d-f16d60e02ccf.description: The course objective is to teach students about materials management, demand planning, basic forecasting techniques, supply planning, safety, inventory management, achieving efficiencies, and customer satisfaction as it relates to supply chain management at the VA.
63bc7e84-6918-4d69-8a0d-f16d60e02ccf.name: Introduction to Materials, Management and Operations (FLG 105)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes and examinations with a minimum passing score of 80 percent.

The methods of instruction include audio visual materials, case studies, practical exercises, learner presentations, lecture, discussion, and classroom exercise. The general course topics include materials management; requirements identification / demand planning; forecasting; supply planning; inventory management; materials handling; safety; efficiency; customer satisfaction.

276e64f4-e763-45dc-8d6b-7dcefd1870b1.description: The course objective is to provide a review of the regulations related to inventory/property reporting and how to apply IT systems reports to comply with VA requirements; outline the roles and responsibilities in generating, analyzing, and utilizing these reports to comply with VA reporting requirements.
276e64f4-e763-45dc-8d6b-7dcefd1870b1.name: Intermediate Supply Chain Management Systems (FLG 202)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes and examinations with a minimum passing score of 80 percent.

The methods of instruction include audio visual materials, case studies, practical exercises, learner presentations, lecture, discussion, and classroom exercise. The general course topics include principles of cost/quality/outcomes; reducing overall costs of supplies and services, purchases, and carrying costs; improving the overall quality of data records; analyzing outcomes-measuring reports.

59a34bb3-8828-4bdb-bccf-61c1ddef092c.description: The course teaches students how quality assurance programs apply to products and equipment. Students learn how to develop and organize a risk management plan for the logistics organization; identify potential problems and the necessary steps to mitigate risk in the stockroom and clinical areas; and the importance of communications with the risk manager, medical director and quality assurance coordinator to ensure a high level of safety for all stakeholders in the environment of care.
59a34bb3-8828-4bdb-bccf-61c1ddef092c.name: Quality Assurance and Risk Management (FLG 211)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examination with a minimum passing score of 80 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual materials, case studies, practical exercises, discussion, and classroom exercise.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 2 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

2126c506-fd80-4b33-8a7e-3d16e5fc2aa1.description: The course prepares the logistics professional to participate in teams, propose communication and knowledge sharing, apply government and VA policies and procedures, and act as a SCM role model. The suite is designed to offer participants knowledge on managing a lean supply chain using nontraditional thinking processes; providing VA Supply Chain Management employees information on how to recognize and eliminate wasteful activities in the supply chain in order to increase speed and flow.
2126c506-fd80-4b33-8a7e-3d16e5fc2aa1.name: Leadership and Lean Logistics Series (FLG 215 & 313)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examination with a minimum passing score of 80 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual materials, case studies, practical exercises, learner presentations, discussion, computer based training, and classroom exercise.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 college credit. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

f8b5b484-f626-4e07-a1ef-fa5952fe562c.description: The course objective is to provide an introductory understanding of the general principles and fundamentals of Supply Chain Management, as well as prepare professionals to execute and lead the full lifecycle of the procurement process from the initial decision to buy through the final contract closeout. All three courses, FLG 107, FLG 207, FLG 307, must be completed to receive credit recommendation.
f8b5b484-f626-4e07-a1ef-fa5952fe562c.name: Supply Chain Fundamentals and Contracting Series (FLG 107, 207, & 307)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examination with a minimum passing score of 80 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual materials, case studies, practical exercises, learner presentations, discussion, classroom exercise, and computer-based training.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

aa74b406-16cc-4572-9163-8bd159f0ff72.description: The course introduces the importance of expressing information effectively verbally and in writing, to individuals and groups, considering the audience, usefulness of the information to the audience, and nature of the information. At the advanced level, it prepares professionals to lead cross-functional teams, supervise day-to-day functions of the organization, and conduct medium-range planning. All three courses, FLG 109, FLG 209, FLG 309, must be completed to receive credit recommendation.
aa74b406-16cc-4572-9163-8bd159f0ff72.name: Business Skills Series (FLG 109, 209, & 309)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examination with a minimum passing score of 80 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual materials, case studies, practical exercises, learner presentations, discussion, classroom exercise, and computer-based training.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 4 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

c0ee671f-21e5-408c-921b-0d14d0a1d871.description: The course objective is to introduce the technical and management activities associated with total lifecycle logistics support focused on the costs associated with maintenance operations, production and support and deployment planning. Students further develop knowledge of the importance and implementation of total lifecycle logistics. All three courses, FLG 112, FLG 212, FLG 312, must be completed to receive credit recommendation.
c0ee671f-21e5-408c-921b-0d14d0a1d871.name: Lifecycle Logistics Series (FLG 112, 212, & 312)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examination with minimum passing score of 80 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual materials, case studies, practical exercises, learner presentations, discussion, classroom exercise and computer-based learning.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

b0e4f873-beba-427c-b138-f40ea540d10a.description: The course objective is to explore the VA Strategic Plan and focus on how to successfully enforce the concepts, policies and procedures related to supply-chain focused VA strategic initiatives and programs. All three courses, FLG 106, FLG 206, FLG 400, must be completed to receive credit recommendation.
b0e4f873-beba-427c-b138-f40ea540d10a.name: Strategic Program Series (FLG 106, 206, & 400)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examination with a minimum passing score of 80 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual materials, case studies, practical exercises, learner presentations, discussion, classroom exercise, and computer-based training.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

3adba3a5-4b0d-47d1-a7c3-8624e5c07928.description: The course objective is to explore the fundamental processes related to Strategic Sourcing, Return-on-Investment, and Program/Project management relative to supply chain management. The general course topics include sourcing (definitions, drivers, and benefits); return on investment definition and calculations; ROI project evaluations; stakeholders and stakeholder management; communications strategies; project evaluation; project teams; metrics; project evaluation and success.
3adba3a5-4b0d-47d1-a7c3-8624e5c07928.name: Strategic Sourcing, ROI, and Pgm/Proj Mgt Series (FLG 208, 220, & 310)
